text: On Tap at the Brewery. Subtle Hop, malt aroma with light copper body and Medium, lasting head. Malt and bread flavor with hints of hops. Light citrus and bitter aftertaste. Well balanced, a good lager

Many thanks for my lovely wife to noticing Total Tap Takeover at Tap and Mallet tonight.  For whatever reason, I could get nothing out of this aroma wise, in case it was me, I am giving it 5/10.  Appearance is a handsome amber / light orange. Funky sour, spicy, malty.  Tasty unusual and good.

Draft at RNH with Andrew. Pours a clear copper body with a thin white lacing. Aroma is bread, yeast, and herbal hops. Mouthfeel is thin with notes of toasted bread, roast, chocolate, nuts, and caramel.
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo NY. lighter to medium amber pour. bready, toasted malts, caramel malts in both aroma & flavor. Decent flavor. decent beer

Tap at RNH.  Pours a nice bright clear copper with a thin white head- nice lace.  Aroma is light doughy yeasty notes almost getting a whiff of fresh bread with a slight chlorine hint- bready nutty hint of roast, and clean light herbal hops.  Flavor is toast, biscuit, nuts, light roast and sweet hint of chocolate, light caramel and big cara toasted malts- Vienna and caramunich.  a touch sweet and flabby in the middle but finishes dry and clean.  Not as refined as it could be but this is still pretty good overall.

On tap @ Rattle N Hum.
Orange/gold and clear with barely any head. Fairly light aroma with a bit of caramel and malt. A bit more taste than I was expecting given the weak aroma, some bready malts come out on the palate, and a bit of toast. Nothing special, but crisp and refreshing.

On tap at Rattle n Hum with Steph.   Color looked good for the style.. dark copper.  Nothing worth going out of your way for... Brooklyn Lager is probably better.   Kind of like your run of the mill lager but with a fuller body, caramel with an slight tang, and sharper finish.
draft from R&H. Poured a brownish amber with averagey head. Some malts, light caramel and some hops to end. OK.

On tap at Rattle.  Pours a clear orange with a thin beige head.  Nutty, clean malt and toast.  Malt with some nice toast and malt.  Malty and clean, very clean and crisp. Very well done.  Overall rather nice and much more than I expected.
On Tap Rattle-N-Hum NYC. Nice clear copper pour with a small head that did not last. Crisp clean bitter and refreshing. A nice session beer. Gonna hope to try it again in summer. (I know, good luck!)

On Tap at the Brewery. Subtle Hop, malt aroma with light copper body and Medium, lasting head.  Malt and bread flavor with hints of hops. Light citrus and bitter aftertaste.   Well balanced, a good lager
